alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Eastern Hampden; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southern Worcester; Western Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with gusty winds and heavy rainfall will impact portions of Central Massachusetts through 500 PM... At 403 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from near Brookline southwestward to around Brimfield. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, very heavy rainfall and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor tree damage, such as downed branches. Rainfall will cause minor flooding of low lying, urban and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Lowell, Lawrence, Framingham, Methuen, Leominster, Fitchburg, Billerica, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Chelmsford, Andover, Dracut, Tewksbury, Westford, Acton, Hudson, Westborough, Grafton and Concord. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Central Middlesex County; Eastern Hampden; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southern Worcester; Western Essex
